newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PLDT to file for rate hike this month.
newsitem.headline: PLDT to file for rate hike this month.

text.p: Philippine Long Distance Telephone Co (PLDT) said on Wednesday it will file an application with the National Telecommunications Commission (NTC) by the end of the month to raise monthly basic telephone rates.

PLDT executive vice-president Jose de Jesus told reporters that flat rates for ordinary PLDT customers will be raised by 120 pesos from 250 pesos while rates to business customers will be increased by 180 pesos to 576 pesos.
According to De Jesus, PLDT will also ask the approval of the NTC for a metering scheme where a usage allowance fee will be charged.
Under the metering scheme, PLDT will charge flat rates up to 500 minutes of local call use and then a 50 centavo per minute charge.
At present, PLDT charges a flat rate for local calls regardless of the length of calls. The metering scheme is expected to lead to more efficient usage of telephone lines.
The official said PLDT's last rate adjustment was in 1983 and that the proposed increases will not catch up with rising inflation levels.
